poem:
### Awakening at Southbank  

Strokes of shadow,  
Marina's hand—  
an echo, a bridge  
across cracks in autumn's breath.  

Silent resilience sprouts  
where father's anger fades.  
Walls whispered open,  
as queues dissolve into light,  
hearts unclenched  
by art's tender ferocity.  

October warms my bones anew,  
I walk through walls.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "My cultural awakening: a Marina Abramović show helped me to stop hating my abusive father On an unseasonably warm day in October 2023, I arrived, ahead of the queues, at London’s Southbank Centre for a conceptual art takeover by the world-famous Marina Abramović Institute. I had recently read Marina’s memoir Walk Through Walls, which had resonated. So, when I’d seen the event advertised – hours-long performances by artists she’d invited, curated and introduced by Marina". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: My cultural awakening: a Marina Abramović show helped me to stop hating my abusive father On an unseasonably warm day in October 2023, I arrived, ahead of the queues, at London’s Southbank Centre for a conceptual art takeover by the world-famous Marina Abramović Institute. I had recently read Marina’s memoir Walk Through Walls, which had resonated. So, when I’d seen the event advertised – hours-long performances by artists she’d invited, curated and introduced by Marina
